metadata.feature_description: Access and view files in a user's personal folder

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify View Assets menu item visibility

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Users via Manage menu
steps.actual: Users list displayed showing all authorized users with pagination (15 total users)

steps.action: Click on the More menu (three dots) for a user
steps.expected: Dropdown menu appears with View Assets option
steps.actual: Dropdown menu appeared showing: View Profile, View Assets, Change Password, Force Password Change, Send Password Reset Link, Un-Authorize User, Delete User, Make Super User, Login As User

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Open assets panel for user with files

steps.action: Search for SuperUser Account (host) in the Users list
steps.expected: SuperUser Account is found and displayed
steps.actual: SuperUser Account found and displayed in search results

steps.action: Click More menu for SuperUser Account
steps.expected: Dropdown menu appears with View Assets option
steps.actual: Dropdown menu appeared with View Assets option visible

steps.expected: Assets panel opens showing user's personal folder and files
steps.actual: Assets panel opened successfully showing breadcrumb 'USERS > 001 > 01 > 1' with 4 files: journal_32X32.png, License.txt, messaging_32X32.png, Social_Groups_32X32.png. Panel includes Add Folder, Add Asset buttons, search and sort functionality

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify error notification for user without assets

steps.action: Search for Test User01 in the Users list
steps.expected: Test User01 is found and displayed
steps.actual: Test User01 found and displayed in search results

steps.action: Click More menu and select View Assets for Test User01
steps.expected: Error notification appears indicating user has no assets
steps.actual: Error notification displayed: 'Test User01 does not own any assets.' (captured in snapshot, notification auto-dismissed quickly)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test admin access to View Assets

steps.action: As SuperUser (admin), access View Assets for multiple users
steps.expected: Admin can access View Assets for any user without explicit permission
steps.actual: SuperUser was able to access View Assets functionality for both SuperUser Account (which has files) and Test User01 (which has no files). The feature worked correctly for both scenarios

observations: The error notification for users without assets is a transient toast message that auto-dismisses after a few seconds, making it difficult to capture in screenshots but it was confirmed in the DOM snapshot
The Assets panel properly displays the user's folder path in breadcrumb format (Users > 001 > 01 > 1) corresponding to the user ID structure
The Assets panel provides full file management capabilities including Add Folder, Add Asset, Search, Sort (by Last Modified, Date Uploaded, Alphabetical), and Sync functionality
Code suggests VIEW_ASSETS permission exists based on feature documentation, but testing as SuperUser (which has all permissions) did not allow isolation of permission-specific behavior
